Schilling's firm unable to cover $1.1m check to R.I.

Former Red Sox pitcher Curt Schilling's troubled video game company attempted to pay Rhode Island a missed loan payment this evening, but had insufficient funds to cover the check, state officials said. (Boston Globe)
  • 5/16 Schilling asks R.I. for more money for troubled firm

Documents shed light on Martin killing in Florida

George Zimmerman, who shot 17-year-old Trayvon Martin on Feb. 26, had blood on the back of his head after the incident, documents show. (AP)

A Cambridge-based generic drug company ranked No. 1 in the 2012 list of best-performing traded firms based in Mass. Look back at top finishers from past years.

'Queen of disco' Donna Summer, dies at 63

The Dorchester native and five-time Grammy winner sang dance anthems that became the soundtrack of the 1970s disco era. (AP)

Facebook stands to reap as much as $18.4 billion from the IPO, which is scheduled for Friday. (AP)
